head.title: 9 Horses Die in Fire In Brooklyn Stable

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: 9 Horses Die in Fire In Brooklyn Stable

abstract.p: At least nine horses die when fire breaks out at Bergen Beach Stables in Brooklyn; cause of fire has not been determined (S)

block.p: At least nine horses died last night when a fire broke out in a Brooklyn stable, fire officials said.

Vito Berretta, a fire department spokesman, said the roof of Bergen Beach Stables, a wood-frame building at 1364 E. 66th Street near Avenue N in Bergen Beach, collapsed during the fire. He said nine horses were confirmed dead, and at least four others escaped safely. Usually there are about 25 horses in the stable, but there might have been less on a weekend, he said.
